title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2 ACCESS TO QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 3.2: More vulnerable boys and girls have equitable access to basic quality formal, non-formal or alternative learning opportunities, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, sustained quality access for girls and boys to equitable and inclusive education opportunities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.2: More vulnerable boys and girls have equitable access to basic quality formal, non-formal or alternative learningopportunities

description.narrative: In collaboration with education sector partners, in 2021 UNICEF contributed to the continuation of quality learning of 567,618 children (47% girls) - 113% achievement - through i) the provision of individual learning materials to 222,346 children (43% girls) – 28% achievement; ii) the construction and/or rehabilitation of 540 classrooms – 36% achievement; and iii) the provision of trainings for 6,090 (30% female) teachers, principals students and parents – 81% achievement. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
